VLIB_normal_16

Function Documentation

void VLIB_normalFlow_16 ( const int16_t *restrict  imDiff,
const int16_t *restrict  Emag,
const int16_t *restrict  Ex,
const int16_t *restrict  Ey,
const int16_t *restrict  LUT,
int16_t  T,
int32_t  numEls,
int16_t *  normalFlowU,
int16_t *  normalFlowV 
)

Description
This function takes as input the x and y gradients, the gradient magnitude, and the pixel-wise image difference and computes the normal flow vectors in the x and y directions.
Parameters:
[in] *imDiff Image difference array (SQ15.0)
[in] *Emag Array for magnitude (SQ15.0)
[in] *Ex Array for X direction gradients (SQ15.0)
[in] *Ey Array for y direction gradients (SQ15.0)
[in] *LUT LUT array for integer division (SQ0.15)
[in] T Threshold on gradient magnitude (SQ15.0)
[in] numEls Number of input pixels (SQ31.0)
[out] *normalFlowU Normal flow U array (SQ8.7)
[out] *normalFlowV Normal flow V array (SQ8.7)
Assumptions
  • The LUT (look-up table) array should hold values such that LUT[n] = X, where X is the value 1/n represented in SQ0.15 format.
  • The LUT array size should be at least equal to the largest expected value in the Emag array + 1.
  • The threshold, T, on gradient magnitude ensures that only those pixels with gradient magnitude greater than T will be processed. Normal flow values for pixels that do not pass the threshold will be 0.
  • Minimum number of pixels allowed is 20 (numPixels >= 20)
  • Number of pixels to be processed should be a multiple of 4.
  • All arrays should be double word (64-bit) aligned.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
